Authors: William J Davis, Peter M Letcher, Martha J Powell
Title:
Triparticalcar equi a new coprophilous species within
Spizellomycetales, Chytridiomycota
Abstract:
Herbivore dung is a well-known habitat for filamentous
fungi; however, we are only beginning to examine this substrate for
chytridiomycete diversity. During a recent survey of chytrids of
Tuscaloosa County, Alabama, we isolated a putatively novel species in
the genus Triparticalcar from herbivore dung. We examined the strains
(WJD101, WJD156) with light and transmission electron microscopy and
compared them to the type species T. articum. We also analyzed partial
nuc 28S rDNA D1-D2 domains (28S) and nuc rDNA regions encompassing the
internal transcribed spacers 1 and 2 and 5.8S (ITS) to determine the
phylogenetic placement of the cultures within a broader sampling of
Spizellomycetales. Our molecular phylogeny confirmed that the two
isolates belong to a novel phylogenetic species within Triparticalcar.
The two isolates are distinguishable from the type by the development
and morphology of their rhizoids and we describe the new species as T.
equi.
